Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: FinallyWoken
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was our last stop on our 2-weeks holiday before going back to Madrid to catch a plane back to Australia. We arrived at the hotel after 2-weeks driving around Andalusia and 3-hour train journey feeling very tired and ready to sleep. Previously we received an email from the hotel who said that they were instructed by the GM to upgrade us to "The Level", and were already impressed when they asked what sort of pillows we want (latex? down? ergonomics?) and ten other questions. But when we went to the reception, we were told that the hotel was overbooked and... We were upgraded to stay at The Suite! Our suite (The Gaudi suite) is on 17th floor with fantastic view of Barcelona. It was about 7pm when we were sitting at the living room, wondering what to do and where to eat, when the door was knocked and the room service brought complementary tapas for us! The next day when we came back to the room there were chocolates and a giant rose on our bed. A simple but very nice touch. The room is equipped with Nespresso machine (heaven for me), complimentary 'normal' coffee and tea, microwave, and a kettle (but who needs those when by being The Level customers we have access to the Level buffet which is ready from 7AM to 11PM?). The bathroom has jet shower, perfect for tired guests like us! The breakfats buffet is simply divine. Apart from normal dish, they have a specific section for Catalan food. The staffs are very friendly and speak English perfectly. When we sat down at the Level lounge, we noticed one staff entertained a 10 year-old boy who was alone as his parents were elsewhere in the hotel. We stayed previously in Melia Madrid and Sevilla, but Barcelona is simply the best! Really, the hotel has made us difficult to leave the room and wander around Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: 999nat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my boyfriend. I booked through lastminute.com and booked a 'city view' room. When we arrived, we were on floor 5 and looked out straight into another high rise building - not quite what I was expecting. All the buildings in Barcelona are high and unless we were on level 19 or similar I can't imagine that the view would have been that spectacular. That aside, the room was a good size and comfortable. The bed was amazingly comfy and the shower was great. I was suprised that there weren't tea or coffee making facilities in the room and could have really done with that before a day of exploring the city! We never ate at the hotel but had drinks in the Q Lounge. Very good cocktails but pricey, as you'd probably expect! We only had one good meal out, that was in an Italian round the corner called Tramonti 1980. The tapas we tried everywhere was terrible which was a real disappointment. I would recommend the Hotel Melia - it's in a good location, not that noisy, and when I told staff that I couldn't work the safe box they sent someone straight up to the room to help me. And it's well worth trying to walk everywhere rather than catching buses/cabs so bring comfy shoes - you see so much more!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilypond_808
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine booked the Hotel for me, so I had no idea what it was going to be like. At our arrival all staff were really kind and professional. As we arrived before ckeck-in time the Recepctionist was kind enough to offer us a room in a lower floor that was available right then and there. We took it without hesitating. I don't understand why people complain that their room was not available when thay arrived early, of course it isn't that's why there are check-in and check-out times. And this is why we were grateful we could have any room that early. The room was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom had a separate bathtub and shower (with a rainfall which was nice). I was surprised by the quality of the breakfast. In addition to fruits, cereals and pastries, the usual hot buffet and variety of delis, there was a display of local foods (including various local cheeses, and the very typical bread and tomato). I also enjoyed the live showcooking, it was worth the wait in line. As one previous poster said the restaurant was full for breakfastime. We actually had to queue to get a table and to grab any food, but the quality and the variety made up for any wait. Although the hotel is not located in the city center (Ramblas or Plaza Catalunya) it is within easy reach of the Metro and city and touristic buses. I thoroughly enjoyed the location as it was a residential area. It is within walking distance of many nice restaurants, and shopping centers including El Corte Ingles. If I go back to Barcelona I would certainly stay here again and I will recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: suareez
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent location, 15-20min from the airport and is perfectly located near easy access to Barcelona touristic bus pick up point, several choices of restaurants and high street shopping. Hotel is good value for money, great service, good shower facilities and a comfortable bed. It has one of the best breakfast buffets I have experienced and is worth the money you pay. It is located very near Av Diagonal which is the main street running diagonally across Barcelona and is full of shops and restaurants, nice paths for walking or cycling. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: lrlz17
Reviews.Content: We took a 10 city tour of Spain. This hotel was one of the best hotels we stayed in. Hotel is modern with large well-equipped rooms with every convenience with a separate shower and jacuzzi in the bathroom. Large shower has a rain-shower head and separate hand-held if you prefer. The closet has doors facing bathroom and hallway - very convenient. The room was very large and accomodated a king size bed and a twin bed (not rollaway!). Air conditioning works - rare in Spain because they only run on 2 cycles - winter and summer. Service was excellent. Only drawback was the breakfast - it is buffet style and many tour operators crowd the place between 7 and 9 am. Someone sat at our assigned table while we were helping ourselves to the buffet. However, we told the hostess and she managed to kick them out of the table. Location was great - two blocks from a Metro and taxis are readily available. Wi-fi is free in the rooms and worked great! We would stay here again and really liked the Melia chain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Travellingdave0
Reviews.Content: A really nice, modern hotel. Great bedroom, seriously comfy bed. I arrived quite late and ordered room service, and it was excellent (and fast). So I imagine dinner in the restaurant would have been awesome. I did used the restaurant for breakfast - very wide choice, with plenty of fruit. Great. Overall, not much to say beyond that, as my stay was short, but will definitely use again, not least because my company has a deal.

Reviews.Title: “This is what I call a makeover!”
Reviews.Author: ElViajeroEscoces
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in the Melia, Barcelona with my wife. I stayed in this hotel countless times on business up until 6 or so years ago. The hotel was looking a little tired last time I stayed but I was VERY surprised and delighted to see how it has been transformed; it is certainly worthy of its 5* status now! Staff could not have been any more attentive or friendly. Breakfast was superb - we travelled on a BA Holiday package and it was included in the rate. Rooms are comfortable and modern and the 'Q' Lounge is perfect for a quiet drink before dinner or upon return after an evening out. The temptation is always to leave the hotel and head south down to the city centre but do yourself a favour and head up the way towards the Avda. Diagonal. There are some excellent bars and restaurants in that area and you will pay a fraction of the cost compared to the Plaza Catalunya/Ramblas area. All are within a very short walk of the hotel. I made some comments on this hotel via the Melia Mas loyalty programme several years ago and I was amazed to see that they had corrected everything I had mentioned. Well done Melia! Excellent stay in a first class establishment. I would not stay anywhere else in Barcelona now!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, contemporary decoration hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ManuGenard
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in that hotel cause the hotel I usually go was being refurnished, well I don't think I'll ever go again in the former cause Melia is well located for business (50m from Ave Diagonale), I loved the modern style and staff was nice. It's got free FAST wifi and an excellent included (in my room rate) breakfast buffet. The only thing I dislike was the noise in the afternoon because my room was overlooking the avenue. Didn't hear anything at night. Note that they charge 15€ to use the SPA and the gym is a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilties and very helpful attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: Hooray123
Reviews.Content: Really good quality hotel,staff very professional and keen to help with service, advice, and recommendations. Although a little off the tourist areas it is well served be bus and taxi. Close to the tourist bus pickup and a short walk from tube. Shops and restaurants nearby

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - highly quality rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: dhrNorthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel on business. Very comfortable room, free (and reliable) wi-fi, excellent breakfast buffet and helpful front of house service. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great business stay”
Reviews.Author: Pille-Riin
Reviews.Content: A lovely place to stay in Barcelona! Quite big rooms, with both bath and shower, on higher floors wonderful view. All in walking distance, a great location. Comfortable and wide beds. The only thing to pick about was perhaps the lack of english channels on tv. I only found 2-3 channels and no music channel. Overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Cusworths
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, modern, friendly and the rooms are very now. I would recommend this place to business people and also couples and families. Great staff who help out with any questions! and well placed, not too far from the hustle and bustle, but far enough to be quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: LaineyLou81
Reviews.Content: I visited Hotel Melia in February for a business meeting along with over 100 colleagues. The meeting facilities were good and the bedrooms were a nice size. WiFi is available throughout the hotel - in bedrooms, meeting rooms and public areas - which in my experience is something that shouldn't be taken for granted. The bed was very comfortable but the room itself had a confusing layout, with the wardrobe opening into the bathroom as well as the bedroom. The lighting was also a challenge to understand - the light switches never operated the same lights twice, and I never managed to work out how to operate the main set of spotlights. Overall I would stay here again for a business meeting or conference, but we seemed to be a way out of the tourist areas so for a sightseeing trip I would stay somewhere more central. My top tip is to have a gin and tonic in the bar - at €14 this was quite expensive but it was in a nice big round glass which was very enjoyable to drink!

Reviews.Title: “Meliá Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: AHiddenPlace
Reviews.Content: aI enjoyed my stay there, but since I was on a trip coming from Paris, then staying in Barcelona for a meeting and then going to Berlin (where I stayed in the fantastic Pullman Schweizerhof with rooms more quiet then anywhere else), I have to admit that in relation to the other hotels it w

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bit clinical and soul-less”
Reviews.Author: carroll b
Reviews.Content: Good location for walking into the city - it was about a 20 minute walk to La Rambla. Hotel itself was ok but not fantastic - I certainly wouldn't rate it as a 4 star. Staff were fairly good, food good, but the room was very small for what we'd paid. All in all fine for a short city break, where all you want is a a decent breakfast, and a clean comfortable bed with good ensuite facilities, but it had absolutely no character. As a hotel, it merely does what it says on the tin!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, stylish entrance hall, rooms clean and good, noisy”
Reviews.Author: 3breathed
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay there, but since I was on a trip coming from Paris, then staying in Barcelona for a meeting and then going to Berlin (where I stayed in the fantastic Pullman Schweizerhof with rooms more quiet then anywhere else), I have to admit that in relation to the other hotels it was very noisy. The room was directly to the Street, I could not open the window, otherwise it would have felt like I was sleeping on the street... The room itself was nice and clea, very nice bath, breakfast was good with an okay diversity (see pictures). Location was good, short distance walk got me to some nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: plane_cowboy
Reviews.Content: The ME Barcelona is a modern hotel designed by the French architect Dominique Perrault ( as far as I know) The shopping centre and Torre Agbar are just a five minute walk away. Parque Gúell is fifteen minutes away by car. All comfortable rooms are air conditioned and feature a bathroom with panoramic views over Barcelona and the Mediterranean Sea, as well as a hairdryer, shower or bathtub, bathrobe, Aveda toiletries and a magnifying mirror. Rooms also provide a safe, interactive telly and an office desk. Complimentary wireless internet connection is available throughout the hotel. I very much like this hotel and always looking forward to comng back when I am on business in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for Business travel trips”
Reviews.Author: MetroTraveller2011
Reviews.Content: I would personally classify this hotel as a typical business hotel. Stayed there for 5 nights on a trip to attend a conference. The hotel is very conviently located in barcelona, with ease of access to a couple of bus stations and the tram network. The metro underground station is however quiete a walk from the hotel. As for the rooms, they were very clean, average size and comfortable. Free wifi in the hotel rooms was a plus too. The food, especially the breakfast, was nice with a good selection of bakeries in the morning. Did not get the chance to try the pool or gym facilities. Conferencing facilities are good too.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not 5*”
Reviews.Author: Sophie H
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel in a useful location: away from tourists but still only a half hour walk or 10 minute bus-ride to the Gothic quarter. Really conveniently located on one of the Big Bus Tour routes. Nice hotel but the room we had was quite small, looked out directly onto an alley and another building, and had twin beds despite requesting a double. The bar is good, but the spa is terrible: 20€ to use the "jacuzzi" which was too cold to stay in for more than 5 minutes, the "sauna" (of which there is only one with capacity for 2 people) and the "thermal showers" which seem to be regular showers.

Reviews.Title: “Ok with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MosEkaterina
Reviews.Content: We stayed almost by accident in this hotel - situated a bit far from the center, however close to the largest el corte ingles in the city. A little weary for 200 eur per night, but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and very clean”
Reviews.Author: paul_mac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and found it to be a great hotel with very helpful and friendly staff who all spoke good English. Not close to the tourist zone around La Rambla, but central enough if you are checking out sites like Parc Guell and Sagrada Familia, or the Barcelona Football stadium. The tourist bus route is very close, and there are plenty of public transport options available....including the wonderful bicycle hire network.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff, if a bit clinical”
Reviews.Author: The_McManii
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for a 6 day stop in Barcelona. The hotel is well situated if you are doing business as it is right near the Diagonal commercial zone, but still close enough for us to walk into town, or take the tube from the nearby station. There are plenty of tapas bars and restaurants nearby. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpful. Our room was very well appointed and tastefully designed. We stayed on the 19th floor and the views were spectacular over the harbour and city areas. The only thing I didn't like was that the foyer, bar and breakfast area are almost too modern and clinical, lots of polished tiles and gleaming metal. We also hired a scooter which is the very best way to see and feel this wonderful city if you can ride one of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel a Gem In Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: billmarylewes
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for three nights and were met by very friendly staff at the reception and shown to our room on the 21st floor(city view room) views offer the city were superb the room was a good size and the bathroom was big as well with a great jacuzzi and shower,yes it is a bit away from the city center but we would suggest the city tourist hop on hop off bus that has a stop 5 mins from the hotel,we were able to access all the city attractions this way,this hotel is just fab will stay there when next visiting Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean with great amenities; a little distance from center city but doable”
Reviews.Author: prs2007
Reviews.Content: When traveling alone it is important to me that a hotel be in a safe area, with reasonable amount of staff and easy access to the internet. Finding that at a reasonable cost is sometimes a challenge but in Barcelona the Melia Barcelona was a good find. The rooms have WIFI, are clean, well appointed and quiet. There are a number of staff at the desk and they are friendly, speak english and offer sound advice on transportation and activities. They also do currency exchange at the hotel which proved helpful to me when I ran low on euros. The hotel is located in the 'financial' district which is a business are of the city. It is close to several bus stops and within a few blocks of a major 'shopping mall'. At the mall there are a number of additional bus and tourist bus stops. The hotel is surrounded by neighborhood eateries and shops making quick, inexpensive meals easy. The restaurant in the hotel is very nice with a nice selection of items including things children would recognize and enjoy. The hotel is also a 19 Euro shuttle ride from the airport. Very reasonable. In order to get to the center city tourist attractions you will need to take a bus or jump on the tourist bus. It is about a 10 euro taxi ride to center city and 15 euro to the waterfront area. I recommend the hotel for business travelers. If you are a leisure traveler looking for a higher end hotel at a lower cost, it is a viable option. It is close enough to the attractions to make it worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Joanna A
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 4 nights. When we arrived we got shown up to our room, the room was a good size, but with very dirty carpets, and hairs in our bath that didn't belong to us. The bathroom was a good size with a jacuzzi bath and a waterfall shower. The bed was very comfortable, but unfortunately one morning I was woken by works going on and the other nights I could hear sirens all throughout the night. My other half didn't wake to the sirens though, but I am a lighter sleeper than him. We didn't have breakfast there as there was a lovely coffee shop just opposite so we went there for breakfast. Make sure even if its 7pm and your just in your room to put the do not disturb sign on as we were in our room, on the first day my other half had done a long drive and decided to have a nap whilst I had a bath before going out for dinner and at around 7pm without knocking a maid walked right in!! Before leaving the hotel make sure you check the bill as the tried charged us 23euros for the mini bar when we had had 1 bottle of water, also 5euros for a coffee and another 5 euros to bring the coffee to the room. Car parking is around 25euros a day also. I didn't mind the hotel being a little out the way as taxis are so frequent. and we paid around 6 euros to get into the centre. The staff overall were friendly, but we found it very expensive for what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money...”
Reviews.Author: Leonora M
Reviews.Content: Good value for money is the best comment i can make....location and view are not great - 20 min away from Avenida Grazia....good local tapas restaurants - front desk, doormen, etc are making strong efforts: nice team; buffet breakfast is impressive for a 4* hotel - so well done; free WIFI

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite hotels, ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Norma_Atlanta_Ga
Reviews.Content: This was the second time Tom and I have stayed at the Melia Barcelona. We thought that our first experience was wonderful. This stay was even better, I believe that the staff has much to do in how you feel about a hotel. You can stay in a nice hotel anywhere. I can't say enough good things about the Melia's staff. Alexis Mazorra Sanchez, the Guest Experience Manager, welcomed us as you would a friend that you have not seen in a long time. Through out our four day stay, he was attentive and most concerned that everything was perfect. He is truly the gem of the hotel. We booked a level room and were given a lovely upgrade. I would very much reccomend the level lounge. It is open all day with food, friut, hot and cold beverages and drinks. It was so nice to come back from sightseeing at the end of the afternoon and have a soda and a pastry. A couple of evenings we were tired and didn't feel like going out. The tapas and a lovely glass of wine was all that was needed for a relazing evening. Monica, the hostess, is so friendly and caring, just like Alexis. You will love her!!! Tom and I agree that the breakfast buffet is the best we have ever had....anywhere!!!!!! There are choices for any taste including Asian. Tom eapecially enjoyed the assortment of fresh baked bread. Don't be put off by the comments about the hotel not being in a convenient location. It was only an apx. 15 minute walk to the train station where you can cheaply go to Sitges or Monserat. The bus (59) to other in town attractions is less than fiveminutes away. We appreciated not being covered over by the crowds. Book this hotel without the slightest hesitation. You won't be disappointed. I, for one, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: eng98
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not located in the popular streets of Barcelona. However this is something which I like as it is peaceful. I arrived in Barcelona from Madrid using the Renfe trains. Following the guidance from Google Map, I took the metro from Sants Estacio to Hospital Clinic Station. From the Hospital Clinic Station, it is a 10 minutes walk to the hotel. Ok if you do not have many luggage to drag. I will recommend another way, which I think can reduce the amount of walking, but will involve transfer to the tram. The good thing about the transport system in Barcelona is that if you started your journey with the metro, you can exit the metro and change to the bus or tram within the 75 minutes since the trip started and it is still considered as one trip. Get the T-10 ticket if you are intending to spend a few days there, its more than enough if you plan your trip well. Anyway back to the alternate route if you are arriving to Barcelona by train at Sants station and getting to this hotel. Take the L3 towards Zona Universitaria and alight at Maria Cristina and change to the T1, T2 or T3 towards Francesc Macia. That is the last stop and alight at that stop. It's a short walk to the hotel. Hope this will be useful. For the hotel, I am a melia platinum member and was upgraded to the suite. Nice of them. I enjoyed the room and amenities very much. Wireless internet was provided complimentary during my stay. Do check with the reception during check-in, they may provide, who knows. Some minor glitches - As I was staying at the executive level, I was entitled to use the executive lounge facilities for breakfast. On first day, I accidentally walked towards the general dining restaurant and provided my room number to the staff at the counter, only then I realized that it is the incorrect place. upon checking again, I was directed to the correct place, which was next to the dining restaurant. Thought its just a simple and harmless mistake, so no worries about it. Anyway the food in the lounge was nice and presentable. The shock came during checkout. The bill reflected the breakfast and I thought them that I had not dine there at all and they cannot charge me for it. I have been to many hotels and usually if you do eat there for breakfast, they will provide a charge slip for me to sign. Anyway they did remove it, but what I was not too happy about is the attitude of one of the staff at the reception when I mentioned the practice that I am used to. The one attending to me was patient and friendly, it's her colleagues attitude that sucks in my opinion. Also, as I had made my booking on the melia.com website, I was given 40EUR per day of credit to spend for room service and restaurant. During the checkout, somehow there were a lot of charges incurred were charged into the room and this credit was sort of forgotten. The point here is to remember to verify the charges and remember to ask them to apply the credit, because they will not automatically apply it. Restaurant - Had a dinner at the restaurant as I had the credit to spend. Verdict - Good service, food - average. For the location of the hotel, like I mentioned previously, I do not mind it as it is easily accessible by bus. The buses can take you to the major attractions within barcelona and the bus stop is near to the hotel as compared to metro. For shopping, the major brand names can also be found along Avendia Diagonal, in both directions. With the T-10 tickets, my wife and I had spent 3 days in Barcelona. Just plan your trip properly. Also, the timing that the trip started is also printed on the back of the ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable bed and delicious food!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights for a conference in the same hotel and I had a great experience. It was the most comfortable hotel bed I ever slept in, and I also appreciated the luxurious bathroom. The hotel is a 30 minute walk from the city center, but there are plenty of nearby restaurants, grocery stores, and bus stops. The complimentary breakfast buffet was huge and had fantastic service, as did the hotel restaurant. All of the food was fresh and delicious. My only complaint was the limited closet and drawer space for my clothes, but other than that, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “nice quiet hotel; bad location”
Reviews.Author: bosslady000
Reviews.Content: very pleasant room with no closet or drawers. Be sure to ask for a room with a bath tub and you'll get a lovely bathroom. However the location is out of the way and inconvenient to the shopping areas, the old city and the grand boulevards. Food, however, was excellent; great breakfasts

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: claudia_m17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at Melia Barcelona for 3 nights in mid-October and were very pleased with the hotel. As others have mentioned, it is far away from the "action", but given that there's easy access to the bus, metro, and taxis-- we did not think this was a problem. The neighbourhood is relatively quiet with some nice local restaurants nearby, as well as a few supermarkets. For those families with young children, there is a small playground right in front of the hotel. Other things you may appreciate: an expansive breakfast buffet catering to all tastes (eggs made to order, waffles, fruits, cereal, yogurt, variety of breads, desserts, salads, hams, cheese selection, fresh juices, etc!) friendly and attentive staff, clean rooms with huge showers and a bath (in our case), and free wi-fi in your room. We booked this hotel through a discount site and got an amazing deal, so our 5th floor room did not have much of a view (just the backs of nearby apartment buildings), but it was very peaceful and quiet. I would definitely recommend the Melia Barcelona without hesitation. Be sure to get a deal which includes breakfast....you'll be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Melia - Wonderful Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swoodruf
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the upgraded rooms on the higher floors. The rooms are wonderful. Large bathrooms with Jacuzzi tubs and multiple spray showers. Our room had a small refrigerator whose main purpose was a mini-bar, but also fit a large bottle of water. Staff very professional and friendly. The only downside is that the restaurant does not open up for dinner until 8:30 PM! There are restaurants and a great wine store very close. There is also a stop for the Bus Turista which is a great jump-on, jump-off method of transport. Loved the hotel and the stay. We presented in one of the conference rooms, and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive lobby but the rest okay”
Reviews.Author: SPatel63
Reviews.Content: Very contemporary lobby, eyecatching with its flower arrangements etc. Comfortable rooms. Staff should be trained in English as it is tourist destination and requesting an amenity kit was a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Nice installations but far from where action is”
Reviews.Author: Narnian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Meila Barcelona while attending a Conference, therefore the choice of the hotel was actually not made by me. The hotel is perfect for this kind of events. It has large and comfortable conference rooms, a nice lobby/bar area and personnel is friendly and helpful. I like: The big rooms with comfortable beds and nice furniture. The bathroom is huge, there is no bath tub but the shower is super nice. The service is also great. I called the front desk for an iron, and a few minutes later, not only the iron was delivered but also the ironing board. Then later I got a call from the front desk just to verify if I had already received the items. Once again, excellent service. I did not like: Rooms are not very well isolated from external noise. My room was on the second floor facing the main street and I could hear the cars and traffic passing by. Not a good thing, especially in a city like Barcelona, where people stay up late. Also, the hotel is located a little far from the main attractions points of the city. Yet you can easily take a taxi or use public transportation to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Melia Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Gill M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Melia for 5 days at the end of October. The hotel, whilst not in the middle of Barcelona, was in a really nice neighbourhood with easy access by bus or taxi into the centre. Our room was comfortable, although on the small side. But what makes this hotel stand out was the excellent service we received. My purse was stolen on the train from the airport into Barcelona. We arrived at the hotel pretty upset and stressed. The receptionist, Sandra, could not have been more helpful, finding phone numbers and making calls to cancel my cards. We were impressed by all the staff we met at the hotel but Sandra in particular stood out. We would definitely go back to this hotel largely because of the exceptional service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, so so room, spa: don't bother”
Reviews.Author: gloriahayswi
Reviews.Content: Fresh flowers in contemporary vases add a nice touch to the comfy lobby, which my travel companions & I used to meet & greet friends. Rooms were adequate & clean, just what we needed to rest up between site seeing. It was only a few short blocks to catch a bus but we would have preferred being closer to the city's many attractions. The spa has a cold, sterile feel, we felt like we were being watched by staff every move we made, not relaxing at all, plus there was a fee to use even the lounge & pool, which was cold. Staff was helpful to direct us when we needed advise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BennyMalaga
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Melia hotel and got a superior room. There was a small sitting room beside the bedroom, with a sofa, a TV set, an oval glass top table, a glass top side table, and a big closet. There was a sliding door between the sitting room and the bedroom. This sitting room measured about 4 x 3 meters. It had a light brown carpet. The bedroom measured about 5 x 3 meters and was quite big. There were two very comfortable single beds side to side. The beds were new. There was a TV set, a glass top side table, a glass top desk, and a big mini-refrigerator. There was a sliding door to the wash basin and in this place there was a large closet with plenty of hangers. There was a sliding door to the toilet room, which included a bidet. There was a large walk in shower. I think this is better than a bathtub, which is prone to causing falls getting in and out of it. The bedroom had good air conditioning control and you could set the temperature digitally. The bedroom also had the light brown carpet. The breakfast buffet was great. Plenty of jamon iberico and other cold meats. You could order a fried egg or an omelet. The chocolate cake was wonderful, very moist. It was perfect with the cava. There were plenty of fruits and nuts. This was one of the best breakfast buffets we have had in Spain. Service at the hotel was very good and friendly. I have a tip for those who have never been to a Melia hotel. If you go to their website, you can apply for a Mas card, which does not cost anything. When you stay at the hotel and have the Mas card, if you are two in a room, you pay for only one breakfast buffet. You also get a Spanish newspaper delivered free to your room. On the Diagonal, there is a huge shopping mall called L’Illia, which is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. You can spend a lot of free time shopping there. I would definitely go back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not a 5 star in my book!”
Reviews.Author: ozandy
Reviews.Content: Rooms are OK but a little on the small side to be considered 5 star. TV only entertainment, no free internet. Bathroom was OK and the minibar was very expensive.A/C was OK but it gets turned down or off under master control of a night! Breakfast was very good as were the staff. Location was fairly ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy Here”
Reviews.Author: mcfields
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia Barcelona for a few nights in early October. It was our first trip to Barcelona. To properly recommend this hotel, I think it's important to share a little bit about Barcelona itself. The city, unlike Madrid, is very spread out. In Madrid, everything seemed to be in walking distance and this was not the case in Barcelona. As the other reviewers said, this hotel is not in the Center of the City. However, I was GLAD not to be in the center of the city. I did not like the Ramblas (at all!!) it was cheap, filled with tourists and by far the only bad meal we ever had in Spain! The Gothic Quarter is interesting to visit and its nice to see the coast but the real highlights of Barcelona, to us, were Park Guell and the Sagrada Familia. Both of these sites are not close to the center and require a metro ride ---- the Melia Barcelona was much closer to these sites than a hotel in the center of the city would have been. Also, the neighborhood that the Melia is in is fantastic! It's a bit residential but there are amazing bakeries (check out Natcha across the street!), great restaurants and good shopping. I wish we had more time to explore this quaint neighborhood. I also liked being in this part of town, versus the center, because there are far less tourists. For us, we got a more authentic experience of Barcelona by staying here. The metro was about 10 minute walk and that's how we got around. As for the hotel itself, it was quite nice. A step up from a typical Marriott, but nothing over the top. Our room was on the 15th floor, clean, nice bathroom, quiet. No complaints. The front desk was very helpful in making restaurant recommendations --- we wanted authentic paella and there's a FABULOUS spot down the road, they got us a reservation at a very well known Barcelona seafood restaurant that was about a $5 cab ride. I would definitely stay here again and skip the Ramblas area completely and explore this charming neighborhood a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, far from center and metro.”
Reviews.Author: immerunterweg
Reviews.Content: good for a business trip, and there's an all you can eat sushi belt restaurant down the street. Rooms are nice, breakfast good albeit crowded. Too bad about the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and only a 10 min bus ride from the real centre”
Reviews.Author: Llahsram
Reviews.Content: As with other reviews, I would agree with the helpfulness of staff, and the impressive foyer. The breakfast is to die for: the best buffet ever. Literally a 3 min walk to the no 59 bus into town, and 4 mins to the Tourist bus-stop. Good cafe 100 metres away for great early morning coffee, super restaurants diagonally across road (if you can't be bothered to go into town) and a really good shopping mall on Diagonal, only 10 mins stroll away (the great thing about this mall is that it has every shop you could want, but is quieter that middle of town). One reviewer commented on the small-ness of the rooms: they are perfectly adequate for a 3/4 nighter. Would highly recommend (as I would taking one of the evening cycle tours: a great way to see some of the off-beat places)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: patpgr
Reviews.Content: Our two nights here enabled us to take full advantage of The Level lounge and try out the spa. All the hotel staff were really friendly and helpful. The public areas were large and welcoming however our room (we had a The Level room on the 16th floor) felt just too small to be really comfortable and the layout was not optimal. As an example the fixed table for the coffee making equipment was just a tad too far away from the power socket to be safely used. The views were great and the pillows the most comfortable I have ever experienced. The hotel is close to the number 59 bus route which links you easily to the centre of Las Ramblas and Port Olympic. The area of the hotel itself also offers some good shopping and eating options. As mentioned by a previous reviewer the buffet breakfast was just fantastic. Overall - a good hotel but I would probably explore other options for my next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A real winner! 5 Star all the way.”
Reviews.Author: l1106410
Reviews.Content: Our group tour stayed at the Melia Barcelona for two nights and I wish it had been three. Or four! Or five! Wonderful. It was modern and well furnished with a beautiful lobby. Our large, well furnished, room came with a walk in shower with multiple jets and very good water pressure. It also had a jetted tub, although we didn't use it. The elevators are all run by a computer. You walk up to the kiosk, push your floor number and the screen tells you which elevator will come to you. No more looking up at the lights and shifting around to find your elevator. It comes to you! The included breakfast had everything, including champagne. From numerous cheeses and meats, to typical breakfast fare to Cerviche and beautifully displayed fruits, bread and rolls. I knew we were in a great place when I saw the staff placing napkins on the table using tongs. No hands touched your napkin. Your first cup of coffee was poured for you promptly upon your arrival. I could get used to this. When I suggested this to my wife of 49 years, she just looked at me. I guess I have to pour my own coffee. Everything about this place is 5star, all the way. Thanks, Insight Vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Tarainns
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel! Staff very friendly, rooms are very comfy and great shower and bath ! Fantastic breakfast!:)

Reviews.Title: “just what you need for a sightseeing trip”
Reviews.Author: ferminablauw
Reviews.Content: Quite well situated thanks to the excellent public transport of Barcelona. Tram, bus en tourist busstops nearby. Efficient, friendly desk persons, extending breakfastbuffet. I travelled with my 18 year old granddaughter who had found a perfect deal. Otherwise the hotel was too expensive for our 5 day trip. Room was not done at 6 o'clock, twice. But the frontdeskmanager let us have the room on our departing day untill 4 o'clock. Very nice, so we could have a shower before leaving to the airport. Very friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Sooo Comfortable, Helpful and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: DavidAWooo
Reviews.Content: This is not a "centre" hotel but the superb Barcelona transport system makes it irrelevant, frequent trams nearby connect direct to the Metro so the purchase of a (bargain) Day or 3 Day pass makes getting around extremely easy. Very efficient check in desks saw us processed quickly and easily, reception staff very knowledgeable and helpful - well trained and it showed. Room was spotless clean and kept that way, beds absolutely superb, air conditioning spot on and controllable - a great hotel to return at the end of a days sight seeing. I had my wallet stolen and the hotel gave me cash on my lost credit card on the spot - could not have got to the airport without them! And all this cost £72 a night - what a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: schweiz2816
Reviews.Content: The Melia Barcelona is a very cool and modern hotel with all the right touches to make your trip a joy. You have the feeling of being in a hotel that's very much beyond your price level. The rooms are well laid out and very comfortable. The hotel bar is a great spot for a drink and the elevator system is just kinda fun. The location is a plus too --not right int the heart of the touristy area, but a more "authentic" part of Barcelona. You can eat in some nice local restaurants and avoid the tourist traps downtown. The area has beautiful walking on tree lined streets and you're only a bus ride away from the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “if in barcelona, definately will stay at melia again”
Reviews.Author: korova83
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why this hotel got some very negatve reviews the hotel is very nice, the staff was friendly and helpfull. Big, comfortable rooms and breakfast was just breathtaking yes, it is not in the center but the bus stop is just behind the corner and the taxi is not expensive 6euros to get to the center. it is also close to Nou Camp stadium, so we were lucky to get tickets to see Barca play, it was short walk of 20min the only reason i didnt put "excellent" is the fact that the hotel doesnt have a pool on the roof, they only have a small pool in the spa and one more thing is that staff gave us wrong information - when asking how often does the bus goes from Barcelona to Gerona airport, we were told it was every 15 minutes, whyle in fact the dfference is between half an hour to 1.5h - i think it was wrong of them to say something that serious, they should of checked it more thoroughly Luckely we still got to our flight on time, otherwise this would have been a different review.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara C
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the entire staff of the Melia, starting with Palaus Montells, Sergi who made all the arrangements to make this stay possible. He was very pleasant on the telephone and was in contact with information regarding transportation to and from the airport. My husband and I were traveling with our 9 and 13 year old, and the hotel provided adjoining rooms to we could be together throughout the stay, at an affordable price. Only two to a room in Spain! The front desk staff was not only friendly but very accomodating! The hotel is near a grocery store and pharmacy which came in handy with young children. The hotel is one block from the bus stop to Las Ramblas! (bus 59) It cost about 2 euro round trip. The hotel is clean and comfortable and will definitely be returning when my travel plans include Spain! Thanks again for everything and keep up the Great work!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: N M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty much what you see in the pictures and read about in the reviews. It is clean, modern and very contemporary. The room was slighly smaller than pictured but still very nice. The reception area is beautiful and it had the most amaming fragrance when we entered. The staff were well presented, friendly and were knowledgable of the surronding area and gave us great tips about local area and what to visit. We didn't go to the restaurant in the hotel only because we wanted to experience authentic spainish food. But make sure you get the breakfast as it was very good, they had everything you could possibly think of and more. It was 17.50 euros each but as a general point try to book this with your flight as you will save lots. There are a number of great restaurants close by and mini supermarkets. There is a great italian a 10min walk called Gino's. There is also subway, starbucks and KFC all within a 8-10min walk! We didn't go there but it was satisfying to know it was close by. I would suggest walking around the hotel area as we found so many convienient little shops. The chemist is next door to the hotel which was really good. I would HIGHLY recommend going to a restarant called Tapa Tapa which is located near the magic fountain. You can catch the number 27 bus, (again close to the hotel) all the they way to the last stop which is about 10mins. Great food, service and great staff. It is open til 1am and 2am on Fridays. Super busy but you don't wait too long for a table! The bus tours stops were very close to the hotel, both the red and blue route were available to catch, we reccommend to buy a 2day pass as there is so much to see and it is easier than catching the metro or the bus. You can buy the bus tour tickets at the hotel as they offer a discount which was very handy. The FC football staduim was also very close by but we decided to walk as the weather was amazing and it took about 30mins. The local shopping destination was very close to the hotel, it reminded me of a mini Oxford Street. All the designer stores, department and favourties such as Zara, H&M, accesorize. On the last night we went to the spa and swimming pool. The pool was smaller than what is pictured but overall it was clean, calming and very modern. The steam and sauna room were nice as you would expect. Unfortunetly I was unable to get a massage as it was fully booked, so ladies make sure you book in advance! The gym was small but convienient and it is free. The swimming pool, sauna and steam rooms are 15 euros each but if you get a treatment then it is free. They provide you with towels, robes and slippers all complimentary. Overall it was a great experience, I would definetly go back and stay. I hope this helps for anyone going to Barcelona for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: PandL60606
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice lobby area, good service, clean and well appointed rooms and is in a great location. We wish we could have stayed a little longer to get even more of an experience but the hotel was just right for what we were looking for. When staying here, by all means, take a little time to visit the Ramblas area and go explore a bit. We had lots of fun!

Reviews.Title: “A design-hotel with too small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ro45li
Reviews.Content: Melia hotels are generally a good experience. This hotel in Barcelona is just that. Sophisticated interior design and rooms equipped with all the stuff to expect of a 5 star hotel. But the rooms are very small. I had a double room, but even for one person the feeling of hitting the walls going out of bed in the morning was very dominant to put it mildly. Bathroom with lots of marble and tiles - of course - but the advanced shower did not have any water pressure at all; water was just drizzling. I had a room on the 10 floor; I wonder how the situation would be on the 20th floor! So, in all good quality, but not exiting. Too much design in some places; the bar had no atmosphere at all! One exception: The buffet breakfast! simply one of the best I have experienced in my over 30 years traveling. Ensure that you get breakfast included when you order from your travel agent

Reviews.Title: “lovely property, look out for deals on it”
Reviews.Author: fearanti
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, lots of facilities, friendly staff (And lots of them). we got a well priced deal even in high season (but not through hotel directly) so look around for them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, well located, Good food, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: OziCouple
Reviews.Content: All that you need from a hotel whilst on tour, the rooms are Comfortable the beds welcoming and the food at dinner and breakfast was very good. The staff saw to all our needs and we enjoyed our two nights there

Reviews.Title: “Nos encanto, great hospitality and outstanding service all staff members”
Reviews.Author: BellaBarcelona
Reviews.Content: Their great hospitality was beyond words - absolutely spectacular!! All the staff members were absolutely fantastic with outstanding service

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at Melia Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SukoSandiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5 nights and found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Specially when we needed to find a dentist on Friday evening. The bus connections to the main plaza is easy and took about 25 mins. The hop-on /hop off bus stop was only a block away. We found the breakfast items were many and they opened the breakfast area early. options were good and convienent

Reviews.Title: “Good service - tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grownupnow
Reviews.Content: As far as service goes we could not fault the hotel staff. The hotel itself is ok but nothing special, everything provided is adequate. The rooms are modern but starting to look a bit tired and dated, with over use of dark brown furniture making it feel quite oppressive. The aircon in the rooms was pretty poor, and was clearly struggling with the July heat. The hotel staff did there very best to help and moved us to another room but the aircon was just the same. Breakfast was good with a good choice of buffet. Due to its out of centre location, this hotel is probably more suited for business travellers, unless of course you get a really good deal making it worth the extra time spent getting to the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great service and friendly staff, stylish and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Merwanator
Reviews.Content: We ran a customer conference at the Melia in May 2011. It was a very well appointed and located hotel, staff were very friendly and professional. I got the sense that they really did care about our experience. Facilities and food were very good, I would receommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not the best hotel choice for most people”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: What they say about real estate is usally true about hotels, too -- it's all about "location." Unfortunately, this hotel doesn't have it, especially for tourists. For a "city center" location, it's very inconvenient. Far from the things you'll want to see, the places you'll want to eat, etc,, with poor Metro access, too. Despite this poor location, the hotel was also inconvenient for having a car. Basically, there's no place to park, without paying big bucks. The hotel garage is 27 euros a day with a guest discount -- and for that, you don't even get in-and-out privileges. The garage is also very tight with probably the most dangerous exit ramp I've ever seen. It was actually humorous to try to make one turn without hitting a wall (the hundreds of marks on the wall record the many who weren't careful enough). From 10 pm to 7 am, you can avoid this expense and danger by parking on the street for free (don't oversleep, they'll reportedly tow your car!), but that's obviously not very convenient. As others have noted, this hotel is extremely expensive (we stayed on a hotel loyalty program reward so it wasn't an issue). I don't see how it can deliver good value for money. The rooms are nice enough and well maintained, but the hotel is old and it shows. Beds are good, and we got both a "waterfall" shower and a tub. Hotel seemed to have good sound-proofing (or few guests) as we heard no outside noises. But at the end of the day, the room was really no more comfortable than at a hotel costing half the price, and I would strongly recommend trading a little bit of "luxury" for a better hotel location. By the way, the thing I'll probably remember most about the hotel is the elevators. They have no buttons to push -- you select your floor destination before you get on. I've never seen that before. Freaky, but it works.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Hanky90230
Reviews.Content: Wonderful 2 days. Would have stayed longer but they were booked. Highly recommended. Not city centre but close enough on metro and bus. Booked Level room with lounge and spa access. Beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All it takes is a smile and I certainly received plenty from all the staff!”
Reviews.Author: Busybee069
Reviews.Content: Every member of the staff are professional but friendly and ready to help. We used the hotel for a small conference, and can honestly say the food, meeting rooms, bedrooms and service was second to none. I would definately re-use the Melia in Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful - do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: bernmarks
Reviews.Content: I have travelled many places and stayed in many hotels and i would not recommend this one. My main problem was the 5 star rating. you expect certain things from a 5* hotel and we did not get any of them. for a start the hotel is not in a good area for tourists - there is nothing within walking distance. there was no bath in bathroom, and when we asked for a kettle and some cups and teas bags we were told we could not have this but for an extra €50 per day we would use "the level" which is an area with tea making facilities - very expensive cuppa i think!! likewise we could not use the pool wihout paying "the level" rate. the staff were very rude!!! on arrival our room wasn't ready and the receptionist kept telling us to come back at 11.30 - this was at 11.40 - i know it was a lanaguage thing but when we tried to get the actual time from her she started raising her voice repeating 11.30, 11.30...!!!! when checking out we were asked to pay ort bill - wihtout seeing it!! when we did get it nothing was clear - when we questioned what the items were another member of staff stepped in saying that we used everything - we explained we were not disputing that - we were merely reviewing our bill which is standard practice for anyone in any establishment in any country. i should also mention that it is around the corner from the hospital so be prepared for ambulances whizzing by throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: spm23
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights for a quick trip for my wife's 50th Birthday. They upgraded us to the 20th floor for the views and I had booked flowers and the romantic package. The wine, chocolate strawberries, massage for 2 and candles etc provided are brilliant and the flowers are stunning. All were waiting in the room The food in the restaurant was excellent as was the wine. You are made to feel very welcome, it is 10 minutes from the metro but its not a difficult walk and is nice in a morning to grab a coffee on the way. Would be nice to have a kettle/tea making facility in the room but other than that, its an excellent hotel for the price you pay and you get a great nights sleep there unlike some of the expensive ones closer to the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a pleasant area of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: VEH80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. It was relatively easy to find, although over 10 minutes walk from a metro. You do get to walk past the L'illa shopping centre which breaks up the journey. Its close to the trams and the tourist bus stops which is convenient. In the surrounding area there are a few clubs/ bars which are nice. A safe area to walk around at night as well. The hotel staff were very helpful, delivering an ironing board and more powerful hairdryer to the room on request. Also has free wifi in the room. The rooms were well looked after, clean and tidy, with all amenities you would expect to find. Overall, the hotel was good, although it is a bit far out, if you don't mind getting a taxi (they're not too expensive) or walking back then would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobdibest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference in February 2011, so I wont comment on the rate as this was negotiated for the occassion, but the hotel was very nice. Reception is modern, with an area for internet use, and a lounge and bar. The bedroom was large enough, with a large and clean bathroom too. Good modern room, very clean and very comfortable beds. The hotel provides free wifi access which was great. Location wise it required a cab costing about € to the gothic quarter, but the Segrada Familiar was within walking distance (probably 15 minutes). Overall a comfortable clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Typical 4* star hotel (not 5*)”
Reviews.Author: MariaLodz
Reviews.Content: The hotel meets the needs of hotels 4 *. The rooms are clean and quite large, bathroom with tub and separate shower. Standard equipment in the room but were no tea/coffee making facilities. Staff is nice and helpfull. Location of the hotel is not good when we visit Barcelona for tourism - it is quite far from the attractions, so it is necessary to utilize the metro or take a taxi (about 10-15 Euro to Sagrada Familia). However the tourist bus hop on/off is 2 long blocks away. Breakfast was not included in the price and the resturants were quite expensive but there is a large selection of breakfast choices, including eggs cooked to order. Very good hotel for bussines travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bit far from things”
Reviews.Author: Lychee82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between Christmas and New Years in December 2010. We booked it as we got a good deal through a travel website. The hotel was clean and the staff were helpful but we found it a bit far from many things. There are some bars and cafes around but they tend to close early so if you are looking for some food after 8pm it can be hard. There is a big shopping area nearby if you want to go shopping. Getting to the tourist sites was a bit harder and there isn't really any metro stations very close to the hotel. The buses routes around the hotel didn't suit us much though you can get directly to the centre from the hotel but it is a bit of a bus ride. Overall the hotel was nice, the rooms are more like 4 stars but very comfortable and the bathroom had a shower and a jacuzzi bath which was very nice. It was quiet and the beds were very good. Breakfast was not included in the price and the resturants were quite expensive, though that is to be expected in a 5 star hotel. Having breakfast included in the price would have been nice. I was disappointed there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. I would recommend this hotel but I would suggest you look for one closer to the centre of town if possible first.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Dublin1576
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel and due to the severe weather conditions, our flights were cancelled so through no fault of our own, we couldnt travel. Despite this, they have insisted on charging us for the entire stay which was very unfair and to boot they were very unhelpful. There is nothing 5 star about how they treat people.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: xxxtraveltoday
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Melia. The staff is wonderful. They even left the reception desk to walk out of the front door and direct me to a restaurant near the hotel. The service is outstanding. If this was closer to Las Ramblas it would be the hotel of choice. But the hop on/off tourist bus is 2 long blocks away. It is a good buy. I was very pleased with the hotel. We also stayed at Le Meridian on Las Ramblas. By far the Melia is a better property. The breakfast is large and more variety than at Le Meridan. But the location is a draw back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but not close to sights of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Neesflying
Reviews.Content: Melia Barcelona is a somewhat modern hotel with contemporary furnishings. The guest rooms are small but the bathroom is large, with a jacuzzi tub and a separate shower. There is a flat screen tv, however, there is no alarm clock/radio. A bathrobe and slippers are provided. There is no ironing board and iron or a coffeemaker or teapot. Breakfast is included with your room and I found there to be a large selection of breakfast choices, including eggs cooked to order. This hotel is in a residential section of town so it is necessary to utilize the metro or take a taxi. It was a €10 taxi ride to La Sagrada Familia. WiFi at the hotel is the worst. Although it is complimentary, you are knocked off every few minutes and it is very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel For Nearly Half The Cost Of Those In The Centre”
Reviews.Author: Pinky2283
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel blind, through Last Minute´s ´Secret Hotel´ scheme for 130 pounds per night. I was initially worried, because of the reviews on here- but it turns out that people had been very unfair in their criticism. The location is in a nice area, within walking distance of some decent bars and restaurants. Not central, but for this hotel in Las Ramblas, you would double the price per night. It is located not that far from the central tourist areas- you can catch the bus, literally around the corner- which takes about 10 minutes to get to the centre. A taxi costs about 10 Euros. A taxi to the airport is about 25- 30 Euros. If the main reason for your trip is the FOOTBALL, then the location is perfect- 10 min walk to the NOU CAMP. The hotel lobby is modern, and the staff were friendly and helpful. We bought their "LEVEL" service which if you apply as a member- gets a 25% discount. This entitles you to Breakfast, access to a an all day buffet area with wine, juices, cakes, cold cuts, prawns, and cheese- really great idea- means you don´t have to get up for breakfast, or go out if you only want something light to eat. This buffet is replenished all day. The SPA is compact, but well equipped. Nice steam room, sauna, and jacuzzi thermal circuit- all working perfectly, unlike one reviewer remarked. The rooms are great. Modern, quality fittings, with a flat screen LCD screen. The BATHROOM is one of the best I´ve stayed in- quality ROCA fittings. Had a deep jacuzzi bath on the first night- superb. Has a really nice touch, of speakers from the main TV that can be switched on in the bathroom. SHOWER was powerful- but remember to slam the door sharply, as it was very easy to let water leak through. Beds were really comfortable. WI-fi excellent high speed in the room. Someone mentioned on here, that you had to keep getting a code- nonsense. As long as you log off, it is good for twelve hours of usage time- then you get a new code. Not a drama, just phone 4 and ask reception for a new code!!! Breakfast was impressive. Quality cold cuts, cheeses, pates, cakes, fruit, or you could have a cooked breakfast. Very, very nice. The staff were helpful and friendly throughout. I really don´t know why people have given it such bad reviews. People need to be fairer on Trip Advisor, otherwise the system fails. My only slight criticisms, would be a lack of room service, and a lack of English speaking satellite TV channels. Very, very minor. Fantastic weekend, in a fantastic city. Would definitely recommend the hotel; and I don´t give praise lightly.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Laurieb19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Melia Barcelona for 2 nights prior to a cruise we were taking. It was our first time in Barcelona and we had no idea what to expect. Sure the cab ride from the airport to the hotel was a bit pricey (about 30-35 euros) and we got our first glimpse of the graffiti (aka "art") which got me concerned, however the hotel is gorgeous. Upon arriving we were greeting by smiling staff, rode through the automatic doors that have orchids inside of them providing a delicious scent and a bellboy who did a great job explaining to us the room's features. The room was nice, modern colors, not the best view, but we didn't care too much. We had what we thought was a beday (spelling?) and well, we're still not sure, but didn't try it out. The shower, while my husband thought was neat for some reason, was my one issue. It worked just fine, but the water got everywhere, which prompted us to use all the towels provided. It's a glass shower and for some reason the shower head liked to turn itself in the direction of the door so that the water would run out of it, now matter how hard we tried. Breakfast was in included in our stay (though I've read prior review about you need to purchase this...etc...it was arranged from our travel agent), and well for the amount it costs, I wasn't super impressed. It was just like any other buffet-type hotel breakfast. Sure there was an omelet station, and lots of fish, pastries, and possibly cheaper than going out (it's pricey in Europe!) I wasn't super impressed. Overall it was a beautiful hotel, the front desk staff was attentive and helpful, providing directions and maps, however the location is not ideal as it's a good 5+ blocks from the closest Metro stop and along the way we passed at least 3 what I'm guessing were gentlemen clubs. We felt safe to walk at night but after a day of sightseeing I would have preferred something closer to sites.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: tonigirl715
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here 2 days before our cruise started and it was a great stya. The staff was pleasant and helpful the rooms were beauitful, roomy and very clean. We had the buffet breakfast and it was awesome. True it was a bit away from the the tourist part of Barcelona, but the surrounding area was great found a great Itailian resturant around the corner and an aewsome shopping mall within walking distance. Would definitly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel except for Location”
Reviews.Author: andrit2010
Reviews.Content: THe hotel location is abit far away from the Train station- about 10-15 min walk. while most of shopping, tourists site, restaurant are at La Rambla, So i ended up catch a taxi all the time. the hotel room is very very small. No place to put your lagguage- I ended left my lagguage on t he floor at the corridor- well there wasnt even a coridor... my room was like: as you walk in, on the left is the bath room, then the wardobe, and the room that only fit a queen size bed and a study table. However, it has a nice nice shower head in the bathroom with seperate seated toilet. There is a free wi fi which quite unusual for 4/5 star hotel in europe usually charged ofr 15-20 euro. but the password is expired every 24 hr, so you will need to go back to the concierge to ask for new password everyday. the concierge is alwasy ready when you need a taxi. There is a big supermarket 10 min walk from the hotel, and a convinience shop 5 min away from the hotel. The city sight seeing red bus tour is just 5-10 min away from hotel near the supermarket. Compared to La rambla, alot of shop and restaurant around the areas staff dont speak english. If i ever come back to Barcelona, I would prefer to stay near La rambla areas, where shops and restaurant there open longer hour.

Reviews.Title: “Melia barcelona NOT 5 STAR”
Reviews.Author: hotfoot13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK but it is not 5 stars as lastminute and its own web site states. Lacks basic 5 star accredition. No tea or coffee facility in rooms. Bathroom products have to be requested. Room service non-existance. But its clean and we got a half price deal so it was ok

Reviews.Title: “Decent property if a little out of town for tourists”
Reviews.Author: kingofbranton
Reviews.Content: Great property here- clean tidy and fresh feeling The food was good- and upgrading to club you have unlimited food from the restaurant during your stay- good if you like a few "lazy days" Checkin was perhaps a little blunt/rude; the staff perhaps looked bored and distracted Locations a little far out for tourists; not a bad thing if you like a walk to the tube but I can imagine it may be a little far in the heat Good standard I would go back

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Service”
Reviews.Author: Norma_Atlanta_Ga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Barcelona, Spain last month on a combination business/leisure trip. My Husband had business meetings, We were also celebrating our wedding anniversary. The Melia Barcelona is a modern hotel. Although it is not directly downtown, it is still very conveniently located. The local bus runs apx. every 10 minutes and is only a short walk from the hotel. When we arrived, we found that the acommodations that we thought we had booked were not availble. Alexis Mazorra, the Guest Experience Manager, went above and beyond what he needed to do to make our stay a pleasant one .Because of Mr. Mazorra, we would not consider staying anywhere else in Barcelona on our next trip. The room was very nice with a very comfortable bed. Yes, the shower did leak a bit. The bathroom layout was so cool though that we didn't care!!! The multiple shower nozzles were also fun! We've stayed at many very nice hotels in Europe. I can tell you that the breakfast buffet at the Melia is as good as it gets. Absolutely wonderful!! There is certainly something for every taste. It was a big treat to linger over a glass of champagne before starting our day. I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel. Thank you Melia Barcelona for a job well done!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: rrazzorr
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel in rather upscale part of Barcelona with mostly residential building all around. All of the sights are within 10-15 mins taxi ride of the hotel. Excellent service, friendly staff (as friendly as they can get for a city that does not usually tip much). Make sure to buy into their LEVEL service - for 35 eu extra you will enjoy a great breakfast, spa/pool entry, snack room throughout the day which serves variety of tapas, beers and hard liquors. Rooms are small but very clean, didn't really expect anything else from European hotels. Nice updated bathrooms with good showers, shower doors are a bit tricky, water may overflow but you will learn to work them rather quickly. Overall this is a great alternative if you wish to escape from city noise without spending a fortune. You will see people writing about a strip club adjacent to the hotel. That's true, but I didn't even notice it until the last day of our stay, rather quite place with not many visitors, in my opinion it was not a distraction.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience, room design a bit strange.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyManArlington
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a nice hotel, contrary to the other reviewers we found the staff to be responsive. We had two very pleasant dinners and breakfast every morning, it was a good start to the day. We got the breakfast plan which I recommend, everyone seems to do the breakfast. We had a junior suite and this was adequate for our needs. I found the lack of a solid door to the bathroom/WC to be strange, the room design is too futuristic for me. We never used the metro system and took taxis as we were a big group. I would have liked somewhere where I could walk out to cafes or parks, but this was okay. I consider this a business hotel for Americans, not a bad thing.

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK!”
Reviews.Author: OKlawdog
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just ok and I would definately make a different choice for my next visit. The staff was just above average. I didn't find them overly friendly but they were not rude either. I booked my hotel using Expedia and did not have any problems with check in. The first room I was assigned had not been cleaned yet so they had to assign me to a different room. The rooms are small but they were adequate. No coffee maker or iron and ironing board. The rooms had a tub (with jets) and separate shower. The shower only has a overhead spout. The spout on the wall could only be used for rinsing since it would not stay erect. The shower leaked water all over the floor everytime you used it. There was also mold around the shower (like it had been caulked to stop the leak). The sink was nice. The bathroom has no electrical outlets (for curling/flat ironing hair) luckily I travel with a extension cord which I had to run from the bedroom. They provide you no map of the city or how to get to to the metro, but I figured it out. The metro is not too far (Hospital Clinic stop). You have to go out the front of the hotel turn left (gas station turn right and about 3 blocks down. Not a very scenic route and be prepared for lots of graffiti. It is everywhere. The opposite direction will take you to AV Diagonal and that stretch has quite a few boutiques and a mall. I found the area surrounding the hotel quite loud I stayed on the 6th floor). Ambulances, sirens, and people beeping their horns at all hours of the night. Try to stay up higher if you choose to stay here. The hotel offers breakfast for 23 Euros per person and the spa is 15 Euro but they do offer a deal for 40 Euro per room for breakfast and the spa (which I had to ask about because I wasn't told but I did read about it in a Trip Advisor review). The hotel offers Free internet which was a plus, but I also had to ask for user ID and password after reading about it in the hotel guide. They offer 12 hours. The breakfast buffet is great!! Alot to choose from. I would not stay in this hotel again. For the cost, I definately would not consider it a 5 star hotel. And I wasn't even thanked when I checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet neighborhood, yet accesible to transportation”
Reviews.Author: YolandaH
Reviews.Content: Friendly atmosphere, very modern, quick service, quiet and well equipped rooms. Expensive to eat in specially breakfast. We would definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel,Freindly Staff But Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: deepikagoyal
Reviews.Content: everything was great except two things...tiny rooms and the location away from everything .... the staff were very warm and helpful......

Reviews.Title: “Not worth”
Reviews.Author: Junovan
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in this 'trendy' hotel. Impressed by the lobby and the bar, the room was not so impressive. Exquisite view, but lots of details to be improved in the room. A/C was not functioning properly and we asked twice for a review of the system. Rooms quite small. Pool bar staff was quite unprofessional. Parking space is overpriced (25 euros per day...incl. clients !!).Gym is quite small. Personnel is overall not professional enough...not responsive and not really pleasant. Not worth 5* !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location somewhat ackward”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, no complaints at all, but the location is somewhat not perfect. It's far from any metro station, like a 20 minute walk. There are buses nearby, and it's close to Avenida Diagonal, but definately not convenient to the metro. Room was very nice, breakfast buffet excellent, very friendly and hard working staff all over. TV had BBC and CNN in English. Very comfortable bed. No convenience stores or markets nearby to buy snacks/water at reasonble prices. There is a KFC and other fast food places about a ten minute walk away at the Francesca Macia roundabout. There is also a big El Corte Ingles shopping center nearby. At the Francesca Macia roundabout, it is the changingpoint where the "open top" bus tours go, so it's very convenient for those tours cause 2 of three lines are right there. Bathroom and amenities were first class, including a great shower with many jets. Free wifi internet was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and hotel but service needs more improvement”
Reviews.Author: rumerhazit
Reviews.Content: We were here for a brief stop during our honeymoon. You will enjoy your room and the hotels location which is still within good walking distances from train stations that will take you around town. It seems to be closer to the financial districts however you are also close to the football stadium of the great Barcelona. Only disappointment here is the service. Giusepp who was our bell hop was the only great service person in the entire hotel. The rest of the staff was extremely snobby and was not helpful when it came to directions, restaurant services etc. I would suggest if you visit this hotel you come prepared and go on your own. Other than that the place is definitely top notch and very high end. Guisepp muchas gracias

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: lettero5
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Barcelona's business center (not the historical center, Ramblas!), close to the elegant Illa shopping center, this hotel is a good option especially if you get a room on one of top floors with good views.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bojannn
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel in Barcelona, not in city center but not so far and you can use metro (Maria Cristina station, about 700m from hotel). Great big rooms, nice bed, beautiful bathroom (with jacuzzi which is great). Gym is not so spacious, but it's OK. Spa is nice, but I was little bit disappointed cause its nothing special (sauna and about 40 square meters of pool with whirlpool) and for that you need to pay 15€. Free Internet in all rooms, cool :) I will come back again in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Bruns
Reviews.Content: The Melia Barcelona is by far one of the best hotels I have stayed at, and I have stayed in quite a number of different hotels. The rooms are great, and if you are lucky enough to get a room on one of the upper floors you will have an excellent view.
