The restaurant is also quite good, as are several of the restaurants near by. If you want to eat out the staff is very helpful in pointing out where to go. The breakfast is also brilliant. The location was for my part excellent as the office i Worked at was only a 5 minutte walk away. The nearest mettro is about 10 minuttes away, but if you are to lazy for that there are alway taxi's parked right across the street. One minor anoying thing was that you had to pay extra to use the internet access, this should be free in a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and quite location, good choise to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ocobankara
Reviews.Content: At the beginning I was a little bit upset to my partner by knowing that the hotel is not at the center of the touristical area of Barcelona. But very soon we both understood that our location was just perfect. First it takes only 7 Euro by taxi to Plaza Catalunya and you can anytime go around by bus as the stop is almost infront of the hotel. Some of our friends stayed around La Rambla street, and all regreted after because of the noise, crowd and the purse-snatchers. Melia Barcelona is in the one of the best residential area of the city. So you will see many good restaurants and shops around the hotel where the elit locals are going. Eventhough it was the standart one, for me the room was excellent. Large and comfortable... The bathroom was dashing but practical. We were quite happy with the crew as well. They were very helpful for describing the ways and recommending places around. Ps. The area is well known with famous Italian restaurants of Barcelona. So if you want to eat Italian at Spain, go to "De Mario". It is a small, simple but a fantastic Italian restaurant just 5 min to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ata2d
Reviews.Content: This is the friendliest and cleanist hotel I've ever stayed at. Totally awesome decor - very "asian" feel. Iberia lost our luggage and the Melia was very helpful in getting us the essential and helping to locate ours luggage by calling Iberia for us. So nice! It smells so good in this hotel - must have something in the ventilation or something and it goes really well with the smell of the shampoo and bathfoam. Very pleasant. The bathrooms were the coolest - jet tub and shower were the best. i would so come ack to this hotel - it is comfortable, cozy, clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Muskan09
Reviews.Content: Hi, Me and my husband were on our honeymoon to Barcelona.We reached our hotel melia barcelona at 9 in the morning earlier than the check in time . The man at the reception was very rude saying that we had to wait till 2 in the afternoon for our room . I requested for an early check in saying that we were really tired as we had traveled for 12 hours and come there .He turns around and tells us that all our guest waiting in the lobby for their rooms have traveled long distances too and come . Any ways then we waited in the lobby as instructed as we had no choice as we had already paid for our two days stay in that hotel .The staff in this hotel is overworked ,all the possible airlines have their crew staying here . They don't have time to talk to their guest properly ...they don't have an travel desk also . Whatever information one needs ,one has to go to the reception,wait in a line for your turn.Our room was very small , and it had a hole in the ceiling , its quite unbelievable as its suppose to be a five star ,but unfortunately it was no where close to it .They need to teach some manners to their staff members.The hotel is a business hotel and not a luxury hotel .Very unhelpful staff , they do help but show as if they are doing a big favor on us . Its an highly unrecommended hotel, pl z avoid it as much as one can . We had a bad experience here .plus anybody going to Barcelona for first time should stay someone close to LAS RAMBLAS which is the most happening area.....PLZ dont ever go to melia barcelona hotel , it is not worth it.......

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: mikcol
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a base for a city break to celebrate my husband's 40th birthday. I booked through lastminute.com and had 3 nights for the price of 2 which was very reasonable. My reservation was for a room only. When we checked into the hotel we were offered an upgrade to 'The Level' which included a larger room on the 16th floor offering superb views over the city, breakfast, access to the spa and acces to the VIP lounge on weekdays between 10am and 9pm where you could have a selection of drinks and snacks. We paid 32 Euros per night for the upgrade which I thought was very reasonable. The decor of the whole hotel is very contemporary and our room was very spacious with everything you would expect from a 5* hotel( except iron & ironing board). The elevator system was very impressive. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There was plenty of choice for breakfast. We did not use the hotel's restaurant. I would definately stay at this hotel again. Even though it was a little out of the tourist area of barcelona, there was a tourist bus stop nearby and taxis to La Ramblas were only costing 6 - 8 Euros each way.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 Star Hotel ?”
Reviews.Author: easytraveler_7
Reviews.Content: Arriving at 2pm,we had to carry our own luggage into the lobby from the street. When we asked the receptionist to print our boarding passes for the plane,we were told to use the business center (3 euros for 15 minutes). We stayed at another 5 star property in Barcelona (Hilton Diagonal Mar) and there was a tremendous difference in the two.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & out of the choas”
Reviews.Author: Chelt09
Reviews.Content: The Melia was a lovel hotel. It may have been a wee travel out of the main part of the city but this was fine with us as there where shops and cafes near by - as well as a hop on/off point for the tour bus - which I would highly recommend. It never seemed a struggle to get around as we have tour bus tickets and taxi's weren't very expensive at all. The hotel staff where happy to help whether that was in getting a taxi or advice on where to eat or visit. The room we had was fairly small but it had a super power shower, powerful aircon & was cleaned everyday. We had a free day pass to the spa but we simply didn't have time to go. For the price we paid with Hotels.co.uk we really couldn't complain - we got a good deal - 4 nights for the price of 3. I've heard that there are many disappointing hotels in Barcelona and this really isn't one of them.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoFLTraveler
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my two night stay here. It is outside the main tourist area and is about an E8-10 taxi ride to the center. The area is a mix of business and residential and seems safe, although Barcelona is famous for pickpockets and purse snatchers. So leave your wallet in the hotel safe, carry one credit card and limited cash, and don't worry! The hotel is 5 star modern with an unusual closet that opens to both the bathroom and the entry hall. The bathroom had both a jacuzzi tub and stall shower. The bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was a delight, with a wonderful selection. The staff was friendly. Many US air crews stay here. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel with younger children.”
Reviews.Author: yorkist2000
Reviews.Content: The decor of this hotel is good as is the restaurant, but be warned do not plan to stay at this hotel with younger children. I was attending at conference with my wife and two children aged 10 and 12. We requested via the conference organiser, a double room with an adjacent connecting twin bedded room, and accepted the reservation on that basis. Arriving late at night we were told that they had two rooms on different floors. We were eventually offered either adjacent non-connecting room with two double beds or adjacent connecting rooms with a king sized bed in one and a small room with a small double bed in the other. The smaller room only had a shower and no bath. We too the second option as the lesser of two evils. Despite not getting what we were promised and agreed upon, they charged us the full amount for two double rooms! The hotel is also somewhat out of the centre and, is a good 5-10 minutes walk to the nearest Metro station. Book this hotel for younger children at your peril, and do not expect much sympathy if you do not get what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Not great location, but lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: donhal07
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend spent 3 nights in the Melia, the hotel overall is very nice, staff were nice when we arrived and left, but couldn't fault them in anyway as we never really had to see them any other time as we were room only. Room was nice, but could've been a bit bigger as there wasn't much room to walk past the bed and place to put your suitcase, was expecting bigger for what we paid. Nice bathroom, lovely shower (not expecting the jet of cold water though when using one of the settings on it though!). Our aircon was only blowing out cold air whatever temperature we set it on, wasn't an issue for us as it was 30 degrees outside so was fine for us! About 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro station (Hospital Clinic) and only 2.60 Euro for the renfe train from the Airport to (Sants Estacio) Metro station. Otherwise a taxi to the Hotel is 25 Euro. Would probably choose to stay closer to Las Ramblas next time, but over all I would recommend this hotel if you don't mind a bit of distance from Las Ramblas and using the Metro which is not used much by locals so worth taking advantage of if you don't mind the humidity whilst waiting at the platforms!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Barcelona is dangerous”
Reviews.Author: PCS88
Reviews.Content: The Melia is a good hotel, the rooms are high quality and the staff are cheerful and helpful. It is well placed for the city tours but a taxi ride from Las Ramblas (approx 8 euros). If you must go to Barcelona then this is a good place to stay, if you don't have to go then don't. Robbery, bag snaching and pickpocketing are rife, a constant stream of victims entered the embassy whilst we were buying emergency passports (the type that will only get you home and are then invalid, costing 81 Euros each) The police are understanding although unhelpful. They are visible but they don't spead themselves as they would if they were serious about stopping streetcrime, they stand around in groups talking. Barcelona is a dreadful place for honest people, when you are not being robbed by criminals it feels as though you are by restaurants, prices are quite ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Kairos
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and modern. The beds and pillows are very comfortable. The bathroom is very nice and surprisingly pretty good size. I had a king-sized bedroom and definitely did not feel cramped in. I slept comfortably, noise is not a factor. Great shower!The hotel's location is residential but is within walking to distance to key spots. Avinguda Diagonal is merely just a turn around the corner. You can actually walk to the Rambla. You can also walk towards the north side to Gaudi's La Pedrera or Segrada Familia. (it's a decent trek, but can be done.) I walked safely most of the time preferring to explore and take in all this beautiful city had to offer. The staff was very courteous and helpful. They were able to make recommendations when asked. Language barrier was not a problem. I tried Spanish and They spoke decent English. Excellent choices and great tasting breakfast buffet. Bread, pastries and fruits were fresh. There is a small gym (2 treadmills, 1 elliptical, and free weights) which is opened 24 hrs/day and a Spa/massage service. There are plenty of computers located in the lobby for internet access. The down side is this hotel charges 3 euros for 15 min. Now, that's a rip off! Better to locate an internet cafe which charges 25 cents for 15 min. That's really the only bad thing I have to say here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in wonderful Barcelona!!!”
Reviews.Author: riono5
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay in the Melia Barcelona. Got a very good deal on hotels.com £230 for 3 nights including bed and breakfast!!! First impressions of the hotel are excellent as the check in area is very posh and has a modern feel to it. The location wasnt too difficult to get to by car and the hotel has its own car park in the basement. (Downside is the high car park price 27 Euros per 24 hours, or 3 Euros per hour if you park for a shorter period than 24 hours, however i think this is across the board in Barcelona as the streets are only for residents parking.) Nevertheless checkin was pretty painless and i upgraded to the Level room so that the spa, internet in room and executive lounge are included for an extra 30 Euros per night. Otherwise it would cost 8 euros for spa access each time and and 12 euros for internet access in the room for 24 hours. The room was pleasantly decorated and the bed was huge, the overall size of the room could have been a little bigger but was comfortable enough. The bathroom is brilliant with a small bath tub and separate hydrotherapy shower with features like a hand held shower, adjustable body massage sprays, large top shower head, this was very impressive. The executive lounge always had snacks and drinks available thoughout the day and was a good place to relax for a little while. There werent many people in the lounge though which did make it lack some atmosphere. The spa was good too especially the hot seats and the sauna. Breakfast was great and had a vast range of things on offer. We did not try any of the restaurants as we mainly went out into the centre to eat. The area itself was perfect away from the centre but not too far. It would have been pretty hectic had we been in the centre due to the Champions League final on Wednesday night. Avenue Diagonal is just a block away which is a very busy road with various shops and malls. Starbucks is just round the corner. The metro is very cheap and a nice 5 minute walk down the road and it seemed pretty safe to walk around even till late at night. A taxi into the centre cost around 7 Euros. Besides the additional cost of the parking i cant really fault this hotel and provided me and my wife a perfect base to explore the beautiful Barca. I would recommend this hotel and definitely would consider going back to Barcelona and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: feidi
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Barcelona. We stayed there for 4 nights, the staff (including the cleaning maids) were very helpful, breakfast was great. There are nice shopping mall just few blocks away from the hotel, it is true that this is hotel is not right in the center, but since this is a nice and safe area to walk, so we walked to the metro station every day. Compare for other hotels we have stayed in Europe, this is the one of few best hotels we ever stayed. It is modern, clean with great service. Highly recommended for everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “The Melia Barcelona Hotel Is a Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BennyMalaga
Reviews.Content: I just came back from vacation in Barcelona and I had a wonderful time there. Many thanks to the Melia Barcelona Hotel staff, who made my stay at the hotel very comfortable and enjoyable. As soon as I checked in, I observed how polite and friendly the staff was. If the staff is friendly, you know that it is a good hotel, and this has been my experience everywhere I have traveled around the globe. Our room was at a high floor and we had the most marvelous view of the Tibidabo mountain and the surrounding area. The hotel is located in the Sarria barrio, which is very upscale and very safe for walking, even at night. Yet the location is not too far from the Barrio Gotico and my wife and I were able to walk easily to the Passeig de Gracia without any problem, since it is only a few blocks away using the Diagonal, which has a ramble for walking under the trees. Our room was very big and comfortable. The beds were very, very comfortable, and so were the pillows. I am very picky about hotel beds and pillows, and this hotel met my very picky criteria. The room had extra pillows also. The bathroom was very large, and there was a door that separated the toilet area from the wash basin area. There was a steam shower and a Jacuzzi bathtub too, which surprised me. The room also had a small refrigerator, which was quite convenient. The curtains were blackout curtains, so I could control exactly how much light entered the room during the day and night. The temperature control beside the bed was digital, so we could control exactly what temperature we wanted. The storage space was adequate and the room was furnished with modern furniture with glass tops. The maid who made up our room was very efficient and friendly. The breakfast buffet was very nice and we found exactly what we usually have for breakfast at home. There were many fruits that were already peeled. The assortment of cold cuts was very good, and they had the very expensive pata negra ham, which is a delicacy in Spain. The staff at the restaurant were very attentive and eager to please, as well as being very friendly. We felt at home there. What I especially liked was the large variety of breakfast sweets, my favorite being the apple pastries, which were very fresh and juicy. The restaurant had some exquisite pastries, besides the apple pastries, which I believe were made by the French chef, also very friendly. I will definitely return to this hotel when I vacation again in Barcelona. It is a fabulous hotel and it really felt like home to me and my wife! This has been one of the best hotels we have stayed in during our frequent trips within Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Melia BCN was nice but we were robbed near the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dub38
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Easter break Barcelona , stayed in the Hotel Melia a modern hotel with nice rooms (we had a fantastic 18th floor views), flat screen TVs, power showers, etc.. good breakfast room and restaurant and handy gym. However, on the Easter Monday and just 200 metres from the Hotel Melia, on Avinguda Josep Tarradellas, my wallet was stolen with all my cash and credit cards. We were distracted by a guy on the street (using the "bird poop on your jacket" trick - we were just too tired too react) and it was only minutes later that I realized my wallet was gone. Hotel staff were sympathetic and gave us a complementary late check-out the next day (we had a late flight but were too afraid to leave the hotel with our money/passports). I feel however, that the Hotel Melia should do more to warn guests not to walk in this area especially when it is quiet. Later on the day we were robbed we had to go to the police station (5 minutes walk) but I didn't feel at all safe evening walking down there. So if you are coming or going from the Hotel Melia, please use a taxi. Barcelona is a nice city to look at ..some beautiful buildings and that but it really is a city of lowlives and beggars..you are always worried about being mugged, and not just on Las Ramblas. On a personal note, I can honestly say I would NEVER EVER set foot in Barcelona again ..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: jameygamer
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. The staff was good, and the bed was pretty good, though it was a little firm. I really liked the shower, one of the best I've been in. I didn't try out the restaurant, but it didn't look good, but there's a pizza place nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Got a lot more than we expected”
Reviews.Author: ClaimingTwo
Reviews.Content: Just came back from visiting our daughter studying abroad for a week. Search hotels and found one nearby for a decent price. It is not in the center of activity but can easily get to most destinations via taxi, bus or metro. Paid 123 euro/night. Got an upgrade to "The Level" for another 26 euro a night that included full buffet breakfast (good variety and quality) and use of the lounge where there were pastries, snacks, fruit and drinks (soft and hard) all day. Staff was excellent! Very helpful, courteous and spoke good english. Rooms were OK - typical size. Bed was comfortable - clean linens every day. Room was always ready by 3 or 4 PM. Need to keep the window closed at night because of traffic noise. Would definitely stay there again. It's not the Ritz but excellent value for the dollar (I mean euro).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: sooz4567
Reviews.Content: Very happy with stay at the Melia Barcelona. Staff at the hotel were very helpful and spoke good English. The rooms were clean and luxurious with great views over Barcelona (we were quite high up!). The best thing by far was the breakfast which was amazing, the best I've ever had in a hotel, both in terms of the quality of the food and the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Thank Goodness for the Melia Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LSBandKDF
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite at the Melia Barcelona truely at the last minute on one of the last minute hotel websites. We arrived in Barcelona on the Saturday after Christmas to find that our apartment had been double booked. After staying in a lousy apartment we hit an internet cafe on Sunday morning and found a suite for my family of four and checked in by 1:00 that afternoon. They turned our almost disasterous holiday into a great week. The front desk team was so nice and made us feel welcome as soon as we walked in the door. As a previous review stated almost everyone except the maids spoke decent English. We spent a lot of evenings in the bar waiting for resturants to open for dinner and we were treated like family. It seemed like Delta crews use this hotel as well as other business people however because we were there over the holidays there were lots of families with young children. I don't think it is typically a family hotel but they were very good with our children even the 6 year old that kept breaking glasses in the bar. The concierge gave good resturant recommendations and even got us into a place for dinner on New Year's day when a lot of places were closed. Saved us wondering around the city looking at closed resturants. I did have a massage which was strickly OK. One complaint I have about the spa is that the massage rooms are right next to the weight room and the pool so I listened to kids playing in the pool and the sound of weights being clanged around during the massage. We ate at the hotel only on New Year's Eve and the food was suberb. They actually provided us with a kids dinner that was only about a quarter of the price of the adult meal. The internet was expensive - €12 per day. The location is about a €5 taxi ride to the Placa de Catalyuna and does have a good selection of resturants nearby. I was even able to find a butcher across the street and brought back some of Spain's famous ham. They shrink wrapped it for me. If you go to Barcelona and don't mind not staying in the city center - give the Melia Barcelona a look.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at Melia Barcelona ever again!”
Reviews.Author: Sea0101
Reviews.Content: My family and I were looking for an enjoyable and relaxing holiday in Barcelona, but by far Melia Barcelona was the worst hotel we´ve been to. We were treated so badly, staffs were so unfriendly and rude. It was also inconveniently located far from Metro, city center, restaurants, etc. For the 5 days we booked, we stayed one night, cancelled the rest of our bookings and stayed at a much nicer and better located hotel near La Rambla. I assure you, you´re well-off staying near La Rambla than staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good base in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jo1970Singapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights Sep 2008 for a medical meeting. The hotel was clean and the room I had was large. 2 singles pushed together rather than a large queen or king bed but it was comfortable. Spent little time in the hotel as I was at a meeting @ the Conference centre each day. Location was close to the Conference centre with transfers taking less than 15 minutes each time. Seemed to be close to sites but didn't get a chance to evaluate. Large bathroom with rainshower which was lovely & good bath Very basic gym with 2 treadmills, 2 bikes and some weight machines. No-one else was there the morning I went. The pool is small but looked great. Had a massage which was relaxing and pretty good value for Europe. Room service was slow but very tasty and not that expensive. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay during time of need”
Reviews.Author: cpassant
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for the start of a cruise when Mom broke her arm. We had to fly home to the US, so my corporate travel department found this hotel for a one night stay waiting for the flight home. Brand new, gorgeous, incredible staff and the concierge level rocked. Amazing rooms, awesome neighborhood. Made a bad time much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; bring your money belt!”
Reviews.Author: RoRoRoses
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Melia Barcelona on Av de Sarria on business. When traveling for leisure I prefer a central location, which this hotel is not. For my particular trip this was fine. Las Ramblas area would have been noisy as several celebrations took place this week--Saint John’s Day (fireworks and firecrackers throughout the night), Spain defeated Russia in a soccer playoff for the Euro 2008. Going on to win the championship for the first time in over 40 years! The front desk staff were fluent in English. To use the elevators, push the number(s) for your floor. The response will be what elevator car to use. If several floors are for the same car, the floor numbers will light inside the doorway. Press 0 to return to the lobby. From the hotel to the top of Las Ramblas a taxi cost 7EUR; airport 25EUR; cruise terminal (“puerto agua” was the best translation that got me there) 17EUR. I did not dine in the hotel but instead opted to stock the minibar fridge with my own juice, yogurt, and fruit purchased in the basement at El Corte Ingles. ECI is several blocks away. A few blocks further was a 24 hour Internet / shipping store. One hour of Internet time cost 5EUR. There may be some places closer to the hotel but I needed a one place shop since my checked luggage didn’t arrive with me. The superior room was pleasant with a king size bed and a very high thread count bedding. The mattress was firm (not hard) and pillows soft. The amenities had a masculine fragrance for my taste. There is a separate shower and whirlpool tub. A packet and map costs 3EUR per person for the Bus Turistic www.tmb.net, then pay 17EUR on board for the tour. Either way the tour is 20EUR pp, so why not give a small commission to the hotel? I had only a short amount of leisure time and was the best way to get in a lot of sights. The pick up point for either the blue (southern) or red route (northern) is an easy 10 minute walk. TIPS: Theft alert–I personally heard from 4 different passengers on cruise ships who were victims of pickpocketing. Even a local had her purse stolen off her shoulder from a passing motorbike. Wear a money belt with your passport, credit cards, and large amounts of cash inside. Anything else should be an amount you are willing to part with or have the credit card number written somewhere so you can report it missing. Never bring your money belt out in public, you can always go to a bathroom at McDonald’s to retrieve its contents. Ladies should keep purses on their laps, never on the back of a chair or on the floor. Cruise port to town–A taxi will cost 7EUR to town (Las Ramblas). A public bus round trip is 3EUR, but get there early or resign to sharing a taxi. The walk to town is probably over two miles. Bus Turistic–Pick up the red route near the hotel. The line went on forever when we tried to connect from the blue to the red route at Placa de Catalunya. All in all, I loved Barcelona. A long stay in the city would be desirable as Barcelona has so much to offer. It is easy to get around and a very walkable location. The people are warm, the food delicious, the weather was sunny and beautiful with some nice breezes.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay, some small minuses”
Reviews.Author: EKLV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a hotel as i was attending a conference at the same hotel. In general the hotel was nice and clean, and with a wonderful breakfast buffet, not to mention the perfect freshly squeezed orange juice. I was staying on the 20th floor, and i could see the sea from my window (if you ignored the not-so-nice building which blocked part of the view). the room was quite small though - it was good for me alone but i am guessing that sometimes it is rented as a double, but for 2 it would be too small. But i know that other rooms were bigger, so i would not worry about this too much. What i appreciated the most was the sound-proof window. Really, hardly any noise came in and my sleep was perfect. The air conditioning was also working, but i could not really figure out how exactly it works at frst. what i was disappointed in was that breakfast staff did not speak english at all. I was looking for milk for my coffee but could not find it so i asked one of the waitresses. she was showing me this and that until i remembered the spanish word and only then she gave me that milk. Also, i was not 100% sure that the front desk understood all i asked them. Also, there was not stationary PC with internet available. I guess that most guests come with laptops and wireless was available, but what if i do not have laptop with me but i do need internet? apart from that, i am happy with my stay, the subway was nearby, the hotel was good (as far as room and breakfast is concerned), the neighbourhood ok, and i do not exclude the possibility of staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: nico_ch
Reviews.Content: Spent just one night at the Melia (and as part of a large conference group) so take this review with a grain of salt. The non-central location wasn't an issue, count 20-25EUR from the airport with off peak traffic. The room I had (a suite) was large, stylish and clean. I only spent 5 or so hours in it and three things really annoyed me. You can hear your neighbors. I was on floor 10 and traffic noise woke me up a couple of times in the early morning. It took me 20 minutes to shower given the low water pressure.I'm wondering if this is linked with the water issue currently in BCN or not. Breakfast was quite good with an impressive large buffet. Check-in and check-out went OK but the employees don't seem to care too much. Spanish nonchalance ? We had lunch at the hotel twice, and the food was quite average. The entrance is still undergoing renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda Far From Tourist Areas”
Reviews.Author: stevee123
Reviews.Content: Service: Good Bed: Good Bathroom: Remarkably good for this price hotel Location: A long walk to the tourist areas Restaurant: No Opinion, Did not use.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: jru100
Reviews.Content: The hotel and facilities are OK, but the food and service I received during my stay left a lot to be desired. The hotel was undergoing renovations in the lobby and this meant check-in was restricted to one small desk (think queues) and workmen caused at least one power-cut. On the service side, they need to remember they are supposed to be a 4* hotel. Housekeeping forgot to make up my room one day. The food was repetitive and dinner distinctly underwhelming. It would have helped if they had provided more than one barman for a drinks reception of 60+ people and the other customers in the bar. The hotel TV system was also broken for about half my stay, making the flat-screen rather useless. One the positive side, the room was spacious and clean. Taxis to town were reasonable and there were some interesting bars within walking distance. I would try other Barcelona hotels before coming back.

Reviews.Title: “MODERN HOTEL, Walking Distance to Subway, VERY SAFE!!”
Reviews.Author: KangarooNYC
Reviews.Content: I had previously read a few of the reviews; most were spot on. Of course, I have a few comments of my own to add! CAB FARE to hotel (from BCN airport): € 35 (supplement, etc). We arrived at 11:45 am on a weekday. We each had 2 pieces of luggage (1 large, 1 carry-on). If we had less luggage, I would have liked to save € by taking the bus to the city centre, then grabbing a cab from there. Seems that other people did that. Oh, and the day we arrived, looked like possible rain. Okay, we HAD TO suck it up and pay extra. Aren’t we on vacation, after all?? LOCATION: pretty good. Someone mentioned a bus stop near the hotel? We never took a bus. We always walked 5 minutes (about 6-8 blocks) to the nearest metro (Hospital Clinic, Blue line #5). Plenty of great places (cafes, shops, etc) to eat in (if you can stomach all the cigarette smoking) or to take out (“para llevar”), as we did once with a bottle of wine. We enjoyed a nice little picnic in our room! STAFF: Everyone at the front desk spoke English. And was the perfect blend of consummate professional and friendliness. Particular kudos to Ignacio (aka Nacho – he is a thin bald man who looked like the actor who played the owner of Melville’s Bar on the 90’s tv show “Cheers”), Daniel (tall dude with funky glasses), and Josef (bellhop). The Piano Bar’s bartender (we never go this name) is also very sweet and he always remembered what we had ordered the night before! ELEVATOR: There were four. I have no idea what an earlier reviewer was talking about. (Maybe she didn’t have a bellhop explain it to her?) Trust me – have the bellhop “assist” you with your bags, even if you can bring it up yourself. It is worth it. He will explain the elevators to you and show you all the many features of your room. The main level where you come in is “0” floor (ground level), and the restaurants are on the sub-level (-1). Maybe that reviewer did not read/see the signs on each floor written in three languages explaining how to use the elevator? To her credit, maybe the elevator sign was NOT THERE during her visit. TELEVISION: Unless you speak Spanish or German (like Madrid, is there a large German population??), you are going to hate the tv here. Only CNN, BCC and DW-TV (sometimes in English, sometimes in German). Bring a dvd player or laptop and upload (or bring) a few movies to watch if you spend any time in your room. ADAPTER PLUGS: We had our own, but I think the hotel will provide them should you need any. According to my email to them the week before, the hotel supposedly has them. We never asked so I cannot confirm this. INTERNET: There is no area to get free wiFi internet service here. (We were crushed!) But, the hotel’s internet service was a little expensive (€ 8 for 24 hours). You may be better off going to any of the internet cafes throughout the city. Many of them serve food (or coffee, at the very least) so you can kind of kill two birds with one stone there. We ate the cost, so we could get the convenience of doing internet service within our room. Bear in mind you will have a deposit “cost” of € 10 for the cable line, that is refunded ONLY WHEN you return the cable to the front desk. We had a problem with our internet cable… first the internet worked, then when we returned from a few hours of sight seeing, it stopped working. Heriberto (the technician) spoke virtually no English, but was nice and with my broken Spanish, we figured out our cable was “bad”. He was particularly kind and very helpful. GYM/ATHLETIC FACILITY: Located on floor “1”. You can also walk up a small flight of stairs on the ground floor (to the right of the elevators). Using the athletic facility is free. We never did. Not sure whether there was a charge/fee to use the Jacuzzi. The water seemed to be one degree above lukewarm, at best. Hmmm, pretty happy I did not bring a swimsuit in order to verify the temperature! BREAKFAST: SPECTACULAR. I greatly enjoyed my Madrid breakfast (see my review). But this hotel blows that away. Pretty hard! There’s a hot bar, including a ton of sausages, a sautéed wild mushroom, baked beans, paella (odd, but who cares?!!), and… an omelette station (I am not kidding). A middle island “salad” bar consisted of: various platters of cut fruit (including this really tasty fruit indigenous to Colombia called pintilla, looks like citrus with black seeds), whole fruit (apples, oranges, etc), champagne (theirs is called cava), 2-3 types of fruit juices, 2 types of water (gas/regular), ice, cereals (we didn’t have any), coffee/tea, olives, hot peppers, corn, chopped tomatoes, smoked salmon, sushi (sometimes), various local cheeses, salami, chorizo, ham, and a few other things. Oh, it’s not that I couldn’t ask, but my dictionary was so bad that when they answered, I’d METRO (subway system): Very easy to use. Pretty safe. If you are there for 3 days or more, highly recommend the 10-trip bonos (bonus) for € 6,90. Unlike Madrid, here two people CAN SHARE the same card!! Generally, you will never have to wait more than 3-4 minutes for the next subway. The subway trains are generally quick. Sometimes, you will need to do a lot of walking within the subway system just to transfer, so if you have difficulties walking up stairs, you need to know this. Generally, the escalators go in the upward direction, but you need to be able to walk down stairs. Few restaurants worth mentioning (alphabetical order)- ANTIAQUINO – this is an upscale place. CERVECERIA CATALUNA – OMG… a local place, about a 20 minute walk from the hotel, near the Diagonal section of town (corner of Rbla. Catalunya and Mallorca). LA BOTIGA – trendy-looking but decent prices and portions! It’s very close to the hotel (Av. Josef Tarradelles, near the Starbucks) The detailed reviews are in the Tip Section that follows! GENERAL TIP on RESTAURANTS: bread & butter is additional in Europe. I know, I know, but that’s what it is. If you don’t want the additional charge, you must SAY SO when you order (“no pan” or “sin pan” will suffice), or REFUSE IT if they bring it to your table before you even order. Also, they push ordering the bottles water in Barcelona BIG TIME. The locals tell me NOBODY there drinks the tap water. In fact, many restaurants will flat out REFUSE to serve tap water to you. On Day 2, I finally stopped trying and gave in but I would order the smallest bottled water (sin gas – no bubbles!) possible. WINES: Generally, practically anything local (made in Spain/Barcelona/Catalunya) is really decent in restaurants. If you dine at a local place, you can get a nice bottle of wine for € 6-7. No joke! Often, if you cannot drink the entire bottle, if you only want a glass or small bottle (half-size? Similar to a large bottle of beer in size), the prices are also not bad. We’ve had a glass of house wine for €1,80 and I’ve seen a small bottle (mini-bottle, if you will) for €3,50 - €4. BEFORE YOU GO: Helpful to bring a small Spanish dictionary or any of the gamut of little books put out by any of the travel or language people. This is ESPECIALLY important if, like us, you enjoy going off the beaten path. Most people in the working world do not speak very much English other than “yes”, “no” or “Sorry”. I am not making any statements or putting any culture down; it is based on my own travel observation & experience. It was very humbling to conjure up my high school Spanish irregular verbs… but I think the majority of people seem appreciative if you genuinely try! Also, call up your credit card companies. Two reasons for this: first, you will find out what the fee is per transaction (yes, it was a surprise to me but using your charge card outside the US, the credit card companies tack on an additional fee to the purchase price!). VISA/MC is usually 1%, whereas AmEx is 2%. But you will want to confirm with them. Secondly, you want to tell them that you will be in Spain/Europe. The last thing you want to do is to be in a posh store and your credit card company thinks you aren’t you (fraud alert), and you have to provide the store additional identification [we almost never took our passports with us (we were mugged in Rome 3 years ago – learned our mistake then! Lovely US Embassy in Rome!!), except on travel days]. Spare yourself the hassle. BEST ADVICE I LEARNED BY ACCIDENT: Chat up your bellhop. Overtip him by about half of €1 (or € 0,50). Trust me, it was worth it. Every time we saw him (Josef) he was very chatty and always had advice for us! Also, if your hotel is part of a chain (like this), you can email them in advance of any questions/concerns you may have. They will respond well within 24 hours! REGRETS: On our (day) trip to Montserret, we ran into wonderful American who used the guidebooks (Rick Steve). I had seen many many people in Spain (both Madrid and Barcelona) use this series. I wish we had known. His explanations were much better than any of the other guidebooks beginning with the letter F. Oh well!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dougie M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for a 2 night city break. After the bus ride from the airport to 'Plac des Catalunya' we got a taxi to the hotel (cost about €6). On arrival, reception staff were efficient and courteous, speaking excellent english. We were offered an upgrade to executive status for €40 per night for both of us. This we found to be well worthwhile as it got us access to 'The Level' on the first floor. In here was free drinks and snacks from 10am until 11pm. There was an excellent selection of meats, cheeses, nuts, canapies and donuts along with wine, beer and soft drinks. Executive status also got us free access into the spa and pool which normally incurs a charge, even for guests. People have mentioned the lifts being a problem. I disagree, I think the lifts are great as you get one all to yourself and it goes straight to your floor. In the lobby, you key your floor number into the control panel and a screen tells you which of the 4 lifts are for you. When it arrives it goes straight to your floor without stopping...great! The rooms are very modern with large plasma TV, jacuzzi bath and full body shower. Only one english language TV channel (BBC news 24) though which seems to be the case all over Spain! We were on a bed & breakfast basis but decided to eat in the hotel restaurant on our first night. This turned out to be a bad idea though as the food was bland and pretty much tasteless. My steak was dripping blood even though I asked for medium to well done. We were not charged for my girlfriends meal as she could'nt eat it, it was so bland. The waiter was very apologetic and could not be more friendly and helpful. He genuinely seemed worried that our meal was not to our taste. Breakfast was a huge buffet of hot and cold food, juices and breads, staff were all helpful and friendly. The spa was very small but very clean and well presented. We had it all to ourselves and had a lovely swim, jacuzzi and a sauna. Gown and slippers are supplied along with warm towels. 'The Level' was great, we spent hours in there, getting our moneys worth of free beer, wine & food, whilst using the free internet to catch up with things back home. All in, we found the hotel to be clean & modern and all the staff were helpful and friendly. Although its a bit far from the centre of things, theres a bus stop round the corner, with a frequent, fast service that takes you in for €1.25 or the taxis are €6. We will be back here next time we're in Barcelona, a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Off the Path, but worth the effort”
Reviews.Author: musedoc
Reviews.Content: I was part of a 3 couple group that spent about a week in Barcelona, and a week in Lisbon. We were interested in seeing the sights, but wanted a room that could be quiet, clean, safe, and had some comfort items to suit our spouses. The Melia Barcelona was very nice, a little far from the Metro, about 5 blocks. It was very comfortable, the staff could not have been more attentive, they are very fluent in several languages. I seldom got to use my Spanish. The neighborhood had several very nice places to eat, and very nice shopping was walking distance . The on and off bus stopped just around the corner. The breakfast daily was a feast! The rooms were very nice, clean, and well provided. There was a little street noise. Yes, I would stay there again if I return , which I might.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MRUCincinnati_Ohio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights from 7/5/07-7/8/07. The hotel was clean, comfortable and modern. Our room had all the amenites we could have asked for and it was tended to daily. The hotel staff was friendly, helpful and very professional in all of our dealings with them. They helped us arrange tours and told us about things to see and where to eat in the area. The breakfast buffet was excellent and had choices that would be acceptable to anyone with any type of need or restriction. Despite other reviews on this page I like the elevator and we had no problem with the operation, speed or any other aspect of the elevator system. The only drawback to the hotel was that it is not in the center of the "action areas" although there is easy access to these areas via public transportation and/or cabs. We felt very safe walking through the area at night. The hotel was a 20 euro cab ride from the airport and 25 euros to the port area where we met our cruise ship. We would definitely staty at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing how one bad feature can ruin a hotel review!”
Reviews.Author: Baker-Mayy
Reviews.Content: The one feature... The elevator!!!!!! This, otherwise, above average hotel was completely ruined for me simply because of a crazy elevator system!!!! The hotel, a modern, sleek high-rise with very friendly staff and over-sized accommodations was seemingly perfect for my one night of business travel but I could never recommend this place to anyone I like... the elevator experience was crazy! First of all, I was on a high floor so, having no athletic ability, I had no other choice but to wait for the elevator. If you weren't advised how these elevators worked, you'd be sitting staring at the door for 15 minutes before it finally opened. Even when you knew how it worked, you still had to wait forever!!! So maybe the over-dramatization had more to do with my stressful work schedule and the elevator just so happened to make me late for an early morning meeting (with luggage in hand, no way was I taking the stairs)... but whatever... I left the hotel, shaking fist in the air... I will never return here again!!! FYI... Great bathrooms. Whirl pool tub was fantastic for a relaxing bubble bath! . . . and a cool flat screen TV which made my husband jealous, which was kind of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Melia!!”
Reviews.Author: ChocNomad74
Reviews.Content: (from Washington DC) We loved Melia Barcelona! The staff was pleasant and helpful. The rooms were modern, clean, and comfortable. The showers were DIVINE!!!! The hotel is relatively close to the metro. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: NiceGuy6
Reviews.Content: Apparently this hotel is doing a complete renovation right now, floor by floor. This probably explains why some of the comments here say it needs to be renovated. We had a recently updated room and it was incredibly nice. We had a king size bed, a flat panel plasma TV, and a bathroom with a bathtub with jacuzzi jets and a shower stall that had whole-body massage and powerful jets. The hotel staff was all very helpful, the bar was very nice and the drinks very good, and the meeting facilities top notch. They had a wonderful gym (the pool is not included with the room; it's part of the spa that costs extra but it isn't a workout pool anyway). As for location, this hotel is not in the middle of "tourist" Barcelona, meaning areas such as Las Ramblas (which is horribly overrated anyway). It is, however, near alot of good restaurants and very close to the large pedestrian walkway of Rambla de Catalunya. It's right on Av Diagonal, which is the shopping captial street of Barcelona. Barcelona has a top-notch metro system that can take you anywhere you want to go in the city (although the stop is about a 8 minute walk from the hotel) so seeing the sites is not hard. In conclusion, this place is wonderful. The rooms are fantastic. Assuming you don't mind walking and riding the metro to seeing the "sights," you're love the location. And maybe you'll see some parts of Barcelona that are not just for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Left A Lot To Be Desired”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. The staff at the front desk were rude. I was also unhappy with the room. I had asked for 2 beds, there were 2 twins but they were pushed together and was almost impossible to seperate. I was traveling with another lady and wasnt comfortable with the beds together. The room was very small. Bathroom was nice. I asked for a converter to use curling iron and had a lot of trouble getting one. I finally did get it. This is definitely not a 5 star hotel. I asked about a swimming pool, was told they had one but it cost $16 euros to use it. It was obviously part of a gym but they didnt convey that. We were not close to anything. Taxi rides to the pier was $20 euros. This hotel makes me think I would never go back to Barcelona. If I ever do go back, I will definitely not stay at that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room”
Reviews.Author: Twingomine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Melia Barcelona beginning of May 2006. My room was at the 18th floor, with Jacuzzi and massage shower. It was excellent. The service I received was also excellent as well as the breakfast buffe which had an amount of choices. Was travelling in business, so I did not have time to look at the near areas. But the hotel in itself was excellent.
